intro: Morisonia pulcherrima, commonly known as the "Beautiful Morisonia," is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardeners in warm climates.
